meanings.definition: (rare) A figure in ancient Greek painting in which the shoulders are shown as trapezoidal.
meanings.english_definition: (rare) A figure in ancient Greek painting in which the shoulders are shown as trapezoidal.

examples.sentence: The trapezophozophora in the vase painting was a common artistic convention of the time.
examples.translation: その壺絵のトラペゾフォゾフォラは、当時の一般的な芸術的慣習でした。

etymology.value: From Ancient Greek τραπέζιον (trapézion, “trapezium”) + -o- + φορός (phorós, “bearing”) + -α (-a, noun suffix).

usage_notes.explanation: This term is highly specialized and rarely used outside of academic discussions of ancient Greek art.

readability_explanation.text: This word is extremely rare and technical, primarily used in art history contexts when discussing specific features of ancient Greek paintings. It is unlikely to be encountered outside of specialized academic texts.

example_sentences.sentence: The artist employed trapezophozophora to depict the muscularity of the hero.
example_sentences.translation: その芸術家は、英雄の筋肉質さを描写するためにトラペゾフォゾフォラを用いました。
